partners.name: BioImage.IO
splash_feature_list: Link models to datasets and applications

partners.name: ZeroCostDL4Mic
partners.splash_subtitle: A Google Colab based no-cost toolbox to explore Deep-Learning in Microscopy

partners.name: DeepImageJ
partners.splash_subtitle: A user-friendly plugin to run deep learning models in ImageJ

partners.name: ImJoy
splash_feature_list: Minimal and flexible plugin powered web application
Server-less progressive web application with offline support
Rich and interactive user interface powered by web technologies

partners.name: ilastik
partners.splash_subtitle: the interactive learning and segmentation toolkit

partners.name: Icy
partners.splash_subtitle: Icy is an open community platform for bioimage informatics

partners.name: QuPath
partners.splash_subtitle: QuPath is open-source software for bioimage analysis and digital pathology

partners.name: StarDist
partners.splash_subtitle: StarDist - object detection with star-convex shapes

partners.name: BiaPy
partners.splash_subtitle: BiaPy is an open source Python library for building bioimage analysis pipelines

partners.name: DL4MicEverywhere
partners.splash_subtitle: DL4MicEverywhere is an open-source and user-friendly platform of deep learning techniques for bioimage analysis that ensures the portability and reproducibility of the methods.

partners.name: SpotMAX
partners.splash_subtitle: SpotMAX is a Python software for the analysis of multi-dimensional microscopy data

partners.name: CAREamics
partners.splash_subtitle: CAREamics is a PyTorch library aimed at simplifying the use of Noise2Void and its many variants and cousins (CARE, Noise2Noise, N2V2, P(P)N2V, HDN, muSplit etc.).

TO-PRO-3 nuclei stain detects double-stranded nucleic acids and hence can be a useful tool for nuclear DNA quantification and 3D volumetric nuclei extraction. This model is trained with dataset 1136, 1137, 1139, 1170 and validated with 1135.

authors.name: Estibaliz GÃ³mez de Mariscal and the ZeroCostDL4Mic team

collection.description: 2D semantic segmentation. U-Net is an encoder-decoder architecture originally used for image segmentation. The first half of the U-Net architecture is a downsampling convolutional neural network which acts as a feature extractor from input images. The other half upsamples these results and restores an image by combining results from downsampling with the upsampled images. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: U-Net (2D) multilabel segmentation - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: 2D Denoising workflow where the goal is to remove the noise from the input image. Our library includes Noise2Void without relying on noise image pairs nor clean target images to train the model. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 2D files.
collection.name: Denoising (2D) - BiaPy

collection.description: Paired training and test images of H-NS-mScarlet-I expressing E. coli cells for image denoising.
collection.name: Escherichia coli nucleoid denoising dataset - DeepBacs

authors.name: Romain F. Laine and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Instance segmentation of 2D images. SplineDist is a neural network inspired by StarDist, capable of performing image instance segmentation. Unlike StarDist, SplineDist uses cubic splines to describe the contour of each object and therefore can potentially segment objects of any shapes. This version is only for 2D dataset. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: SplineDist (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Romain Laine, Wei Ouyang and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Interactive instance segmentation using Kaibu and Cellpose.
collection.name: Interactive Segmentation - Kaibu (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Training data from challenge on 2d EM segmentation of neuronal processes.
collection.name: ISBI Challenge: Segmentation of neuronal structures in EM stacks

collection.description: Annotated images from the Human Protein Atlas for cell segmentation
collection.name: HPA Cell Image Segmentation Dataset

collection.description: 2D Classification workflow where full input images are labeled as belonging to a predefined set of classes. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 2D files.
collection.name: Classification (2D) - BiaPy

collection.description: Dataset of H&E Brightfield images with nucleus instance annotations. Contains 50 annotated images, divided into 11 patients.
collection.name: Segmentation of Nuclei in Histopathology Images

collection.description: Confocal microscopy data (TOM20 labeled with Alexa Fluor 594)
collection.name: Label-free prediction (fnet) example training and test dataset - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: 2D Instance Segmentation workflow where the goal is to detect, segment, and classify the individual objects of interest in the input image. BiaPy uses a bottom-up approach in instance segmentation workflows by learning the binary masks, contours, and (optionally) the distance map of the objects of interest. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 2D files.
collection.name: Instance Segmentation (2D) - BiaPy

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Supervised restoration of 3D images. RCAN is a neural network capable of image restoration from corrupted bio-images. The network allows image denoising and resolution improvement in 3D images, in a supervised training manner. The function of the network is essentially determined by the set of images provided in the training dataset. For instance, if noisy images are provided as input and high signal-to-noise ratio images are provided as targets, the network will perform denoising. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: RCAN (3D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: 2D grayscale .png images with corresponding bounding box annotations in .xml  PASCAL Voc format.
collection.name: YoloV2 example training and test dataset - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Subset of the nucleus segmentation training data from the 2018 Kaggle Data Science Bowl.
collection.name: DSB Nucleus Segmentation Training Data

collection.description: Notebook to load models from the BioImage Model Zoo in TensorFlow
collection.name: General BioImageIO notebook - TensorFlow

collection.description: 3D Semantic Segmentation workflow where the goal is to associate a label to every pixel of the input image. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 3D files.
collection.name: Semantic Segmentation (3D) - BiaPy

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Joint denoising and binary segmentation of 2D images. DenoiSeg 2D is deep-learning method that can be used to jointly denoise and segment 2D microscopy images. The benefits of using DenoiSeg (compared to other Deep Learning-based segmentation methods) are more prononced when only a few annotated images are available. However, the denoising part requires many images to perform well. All the noisy images don't need to be labeled to train DenoiSeg. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: DenoiSeg (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Notebook to load models from the BioImage Model Zoo in PyTorch
collection.name: General BioImageIO notebook - PyTorch

authors.name: Amin Rezaei, Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Instance segmentation of 2D images. EmbedSeg 2D is a deep-learning method that can be used to segment object from bioimages and was first published by Lalit et al. in 2021, on arXiv.
collection.name: EmbedSeg (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Ivan Hidalgo, Estibaliz GÃ³mez de Mariscal, Ignacio Arganda-Carreras and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Super-resolution via super-pixelisation. Wasserstein GAN (DFCAN) is a network created to transform low-resolution (LR) images to super-resolved (SR) images, published by Gulrajani I. et al. arXiv 2017. The training is done using LR-SR image pairs, taking the LR images as input and obtaining an output as close to SR as posible.
collection.name: WGAN - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Estibaliz GÃ³mez de Mariscal and the deepImageJ and the ZeroCostDL4Mic teams

collection.description: Single Molecule Localization Microscopy (SMLM) image reconstruction from high-density emitter data. Deep-STORM is a neural network capable of image reconstruction from high-density single-molecule localization microscopy (SMLM), first published in 2018 by Nehme et al. in Optica. This network allows image reconstruction of 2D super-resolution images, in a supervised training manner. The network is trained using simulated high-density SMLM data for which the ground-truth is available. These simulations are obtained from random distribution of single molecules in a field-of-view and therefore do not imprint structural priors during training. The network output a super-resolution image with increased pixel density (typically upsampling factor of 8 in each dimension). Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these. Networks trained in this notebook can be used in Fiji via deepImageJ and ThunderSTORM plugin.
collection.name: Deep-STORM (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic - DeepImageJ

collection.description: Train a 2d UNet for semgentation tasks
collection.name: 2D UNet Training

collection.description: 3D Detection workflow where the goal is localize objects in the input image, not requiring a pixel-level class, by extracting individual points at their center of mass. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 3D files.
collection.name: Detection (3D) - BiaPy

collection.description: 2D Super Resolution workflow where the goal is to reconstruct high-resolution (HR) images from low-resolution (LR) ones. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 2D files.
collection.name: Super_Resolution (2D) - BiaPy

collection.description: Paired brightfield images of cancer cells and corresponding masks
collection.name: Combining StarDist and TrackMate example 3 - Flow chamber dataset

collection.description: Mixed training and test images of S. aureus, E. coli and B. subtilis for cell segmentation using StarDist.
collection.name: Mixed segmentation dataset - DeepBacs

collection.name: training dataset for automated tracking of MDA-MB-231 and BT20 cells

authors.name: Romain Laine and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: 2D binary segmentation. U-Net is an encoder-decoder architecture originally used for image segmentation. The first half of the U-Net architecture is a downsampling convolutional neural network which acts as a feature extractor from input images. The other half upsamples these results and restores an image by combining results from downsampling with the upsampled images. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.

authors.name: Lucas von Chamier and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Instance segmentation of 2D images. MaskRCNN is a is an object detection and segmentation network, which identifies objects in images and draws bounding boxes around them.
collection.name: MaskRCNN - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: 3D Self Supervision workflow where the idea is to pretrain the backbone model by solving a so-called pretext task without labels. This way, the model learns a representation that can be later transferred to solve a downstream task in a labeled (but smaller) dataset. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 3D files.
collection.name: Self_Supervision (3D) - BiaPy

collection.description: Ready to use notebook for the segmentation of small extrcaellular vesicles in transmission electron microscopy (TEM) images. The notebook is optimized to use it in Google Colaboratory. It will download the original code and dataset, and make the inference connecting with Google's GPU.
collection.name: Small extracellular vesicle instance segmentation (FRU-Net)

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Instance segmentation of 2D and 3D images. Cellpose is a generalist algorithm for cellular segmentation.
collection.name: Cellpose (2D and 3D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Training data for cell segmentation in Arabidopsis ovules.
collection.name: Arabidopsis Ovules Traning Data

collection.description: Training and test images of live E. coli cells imaged under bright field for the task of segmentation.
collection.name: Escherichia coli bright field segmentation dataset - DeepBacs

authors.name: Lucas von Chamier and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Supervised restoration of 3D images. CARE is a neural network capable of image restoration from corrupted bio-images, first published in 2018 by Weigert et al. in Nature Methods. The network allows image denoising and resolution improvement in 2D and 3D images, in a supervised training manner. The function of the network is essentially determined by the set of images provided in the training dataset. For instance, if noisy images are provided as input and high signal-to-noise ratio images are provided as targets, the network will perform denoising. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: CARE (3D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: This dataset contains a denoising training and test dataset for deep learning applications. The training dataset comprises 20 paired matching noisy and high signal-to-noise images. The test dataset contains five paired matching noisy and high signal-to-noise images. Images are Fluorescence microscopy (SiR-DNA) images acquired using a spinning disk confocal microscope with a 20x 0.8 NA objective.
collection.name: Noisy nuclei dataset.

collection.description: Paired bright field and segmented mask images of live E. coli cells imaged under bright field.
collection.name: Escherichia coli bright field segmentation dataset - DeepBacs

collection.description: Training data for cell segmentation in Arabidopsis lateral root.
collection.name: Arabidopsis Lateral Root Traning Data

authors.name: Ainhoa Serrano, Ignacio Arganda-Carreras and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Super-resolution via super-pixelisation. Deep Fourier channel attention network (DFCAN) is a network created to transform low-resolution (LR) images to super-resolved (SR) images, published by Qiao, Chang and Li, Di and Guo, Yuting and Liu, Chong and Jiang, Tao and Dai, Qionghai and Li, Dong. The training is done using LR-SR image pairs, taking the LR images as input and obtaining an output as close to SR as posible.
collection.name: DFCAN - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Training dataset for the Human Protein Atlas Single Cell Classification competition 2021
collection.name: HPA Single Cell Classification Dataset 2021

collection.description: Fluorescence microscopy (paxillin-GFP)
collection.name: Noise2Void (2D) example training and test dataset - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.name: Bacillus subtilis denoising dataset - DeepBacs

collection.description: LIVECellâ€”A large-scale dataset for label-free live cell segmentation
collection.name: LIVECell

collection.description: 3D Super Resolution workflow where the goal is to reconstruct high-resolution (HR) images from low-resolution (LR) ones. There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 3D files.

collection.description: Error mapping and quality metrics estimation.
collection.name: Quality Control - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Lucas von Chamier and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Paired image-to-image translation of 2D images. Label-free Prediction (fnet) is a neural network used to infer the features of cellular structures from brightfield or EM images without coloured labels. The network is trained using paired training images from the same field of view, imaged in a label-free (e.g. brightfield) and labelled condition (e.g. fluorescent protein). When trained, this allows the user to identify certain structures from brightfield images alone. The performance of fnet may depend significantly on the structure at hand. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: Label-free Prediction - fnet - (2D) ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Artificially increase the size of your training dataset. Augmentor is a data augmentation library. Data augmentation can improve training progress by amplifying differences in the dataset. This can be useful if the available dataset is small since, in this case, it is possible that a network could quickly learn every example in the dataset (overfitting), without augmentation. Augmentation can be especially valuable when training dataset need to be manually labelled. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: Augmentor - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: 3D digital tissue atlas of Arabidopsis thaliana, containing image data and cell segmentations.
collection.name: Arabidopsis 3D Digital Tissue Atlas

authors.name: Daniel Krentzel and Estibaliz GÃ³mez de Mariscal andthe ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

authors.name: Lucas von Chamier and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Supervised restoration of 2D images. CARE is a neural network capable of image restoration from corrupted bio-images, first published in 2018 by Weigert et al. in Nature Methods. The network allows image denoising and resolution improvement in 2D and 3D images, in a supervised training manner. The function of the network is essentially determined by the set of images provided in the training dataset. For instance, if noisy images are provided as input and high signal-to-noise ratio images are provided as targets, the network will perform denoising. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: CARE (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Paired image-to-image translation of 2D images. pix2pix is a deep-learning method that can be used to translate one type of images into another. While pix2pix can potentially be used for any type of image-to-image translation, we demonstrate that it can be used to predict a fluorescent image from another fluorescent image. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: pix2pix (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Self-supervised denoising of 2D images. DecoNoising 2D is deep-learning method that can be used to denoise 2D microscopy images. By running this notebook, you can train your own network and denoise your images. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: DecoNoising (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

authors.name: Guillaume Jacquemet and the ZeroCostDL4Mic Team

collection.description: Unpaired image-to-image translation of 2D images. CycleGAN is a method that can capture the characteristics of one image domain and figure out how these characteristics could be translated into another image domain, all in the absence of any paired training examples (ie transform a horse into zebra or apples into oranges). While CycleGAN can potentially be used for any type of image-to-image translation, we illustrate that it can be used to predict what a fluorescent label would look like when imaged using another imaging modalities. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: CycleGAN (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.description: Time-series of simulated, randomly distributed single-molecule localization (SMLM) data (Training dataset). Experimental time-series dSTORM acquisition of Glial cells stained with phalloidin for actin (Example dataset).
collection.name: Deep-STORM training and example dataset - ZeroCostDL4Mic

collection.name: StarDist (2D) - ZeroCostDL4Mic

There is no restriction in the type of images that can be used as long as they are 2D files.

collection.description: Paired image-to-image translation of 3D images. Label-free Prediction (fnet) is a neural network used to infer the features of cellular structures from brightfield or EM images without coloured labels. The network is trained using paired training images from the same field of view, imaged in a label-free (e.g. brightfield) and labelled condition (e.g. fluorescent protein). When trained, this allows the user to identify certain structures from brightfield images alone. The performance of fnet may depend significantly on the structure at hand. Note - visit the ZeroCostDL4Mic wiki to check the original publications this network is based on and make sure you cite these.
collection.name: Label-free Prediction - fnet - (3D) ZeroCostDL4Mic
